CodeplexIssue.Title: PresentationBeforeCloseEvent did not trigger
CodeplexIssue.DescriptionHtml:
Hi All,
I'm implementing a event for beforeclose for Word, Excel and Powerpoint. Both Word and Excel works as expected. HOwever, for PowerPoint, the beforeclosevent is not triggered. Is this a bug?
Thanks.
regards, long

CodeplexComment.Author: SebastianDotNet
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml:
PowerPoint has some known event issues.A very common problem is PowerPoint must visible or some events didnt fire.May this is the problem?
*Sebastian

CodeplexComment.Author: long1000
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml:
Hi,
I'm using the File->Close menu to close the presentation, so it is visible.When I trace the code, the event didn't fire.
Is there any fix to this?Thanks.

CodeplexComment.Author: SebastianDotNet
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml:
The event works fine in my tests.Sure the instance where the event come from is still alive?
*Sebastian

CodeplexComment.Author: long1000
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml: I believe the instance is still alive.I'm can follow other parts of the codes and I also have a breakpoint in the event handler.But when I close powerpoint, it did not trigger the event.Word and Excel do not have this problem.

CodeplexComment.Author: SebastianDotNet
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml:
1. the event is only supported in power point 14(2010) and above. whats your power point version?2. can you verify breakpoints works in general?3. i create an OnDispose event for each NetOffice class. you can trigger them to make sure your instance is alive.
*sebastian

CodeplexComment.Author: long1000
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml:
Hi Sebastian,
  1. Oh, that explains it. I'm using Office 2007.The Word and Excel works properly so I thought Powerpoint should also work properly.Thanks.
